definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)

sentences.english: The busiest shopping area is Oxford Street, where famous large department stores are located.
sentences.chinese: 最繁華的購物區是擁有著名大百貨公司的牛津街。

sentences.english: In a big department store， there are numerous departments selling different kinds of goods.
sentences.chinese: 大百貨公司裏有許多部門分售各類商品。

sentences.english: The department store is selling off its summer stock.
sentences.chinese: 這家百貨公司正在舉行夏季商品大拍賣。

sentences.english: I will meet you on the right hand side of the department store.
sentences.chinese: 我將在百貨公司的右手邊與你會面。

sentences.english: Morgan:No wonder the department stores earn billions in a single day.
sentences.chinese: 難怪百貨公司可以在一天就賺進上億的鈔票。

sentences.english: It's funny because Macy's owns Bloomingdale's.
sentences.chinese: 有趣的是，布魯明戴爾本身就是梅西百貨公司旗下的。

sentences.english: I saw Wender in department store.
sentences.chinese: 我在百貨公司看見了文德。

sentences.english: Could you drop me off at the department store?
sentences.chinese: 你能讓我在百貨公司下車嗎？

sentences.english: One day when women's dresses were on sale at the FarEast Department Store.
sentences.chinese: 一天在遠東百貨公司正在銷售女士裙子。

sentences.english: The Lins were in a modern department store in Taipei.
sentences.chinese: 林家的人在臺北一家現代化的百貨公司裏。

sentences.english: but he owns a massive department store in London.
sentences.chinese: 但他在倫敦有一個規模巨大的百貨公司。

sentences.english: At Weber's department store. It was on sale.
sentences.chinese: 在魏伯百貨公司，那是在大減價。

sentences.english: After that, he became the Chief Designer of department store Lane Crawford.
sentences.chinese: 之後，任氏出任連卡佛百貨公司之首席設計師。

sentences.english: Father Christmas in the department stores are especially adored by kids.
sentences.chinese: 百貨公司裏的聖誕老公公特別受到孩子們的喜愛。

sentences.english: The department store offered giveaways to customers with the purchase of their product.
sentences.chinese: 這家百貨公司提供贈品給來店購物的客人。

sentences.english: As you know, there are many department stores in New York.
sentences.chinese: 紐約有很多的百貨公司。

definition: shopping mall/shopping center/department store/emporium/CL:家[jia1]/the business world
market/store/mall (usually specializing in a particular product category such as furniture)
